column4: Here's a n00blet question: why is gcc not in my path and how do I go about fixing that?
Note that perhaps compiling stuff isn't a good idea, if you didn;'t know that answer.
A few simple rules: 1) Never compile what is packaged. 2) Source packages can be modified 3) /usr/local
It might sound condescending, but we DO get people here with an apache source install, who claim they needed to compile it for php support.
if you install unpackaged files, install them to /usr/local, that way they won't interfere with files from packages.
No, under $HOME is fine too. Just not to / or /usr basically.
... or synaptic is handy for searching, too.
The dir is probably in /usr/local now.
Hit arrow-up until the exact command is on the screen, then paste that command here.
